column4: Hi, I can't log in to MSN messenger using any client - Empathy, centerim, finch, the web messenger client in firefox, etc. HOw can I go about debugging this?
try pidgin? what are the errors you're seeing?
one sec while I install it, though i've not experienced any errors with any client - they all just fail to connect
pidgin tells me that my connection was refused
slight update, seems that web-messenger does work, but i'd much rather have a decent client running :D
check with #pidgin with your error message
check with #pidgin with your error message
are you at work? do they block that port?
at home, ports are forwarded, though fwiw (should've mentioned this earlier, sorry) I can't sign on with anything but the official client in Windows
wait, so you have your firewall redirect all msn traffic to your windows box?
my windows box is my ubuntu box, and no, not by default - tried it for testing, and it didn't seem to make any difference
the next troublshooting step would be to install tcpdump and investigate why the packets aren't reaching where they are supposed to
righto, gimme a few mins to install and look for howtos or peruse man pages, etc
wireshark might be a little easier that tcpdump it's basically a gui to libpcap
just did a quick ping - messenger.hotmail.com isn't responding (IP is 64.4.9.254, and that doesn't respond to ping either)
a few IPs in the list seem to be losing packets, the main one is 213.123.109.6. Want a pastebin of the output?
nah thats ok, not all hops will respond to ping, i'm really not familiar on how msn handshakes, the folks in #pidgin or other places would know the protocol better than i
righto, i'll move on over and bother them for a bit - thanks for pointing me in the right direction (and introducing me to mtr - seems to be a rather handy tool! :D)
